channel.title: Amazon Web Services Service Status
Current service status feed for Amazon Web Services.
channel.generator: AWS Service Health Dashboard RSS Generator

item.title: Informational message: Increased instance launch error rates
item.description: We are investigating increased error rates for new instance launches in a single Availability Zone in the US-WEST-1 Region.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Elevated email-sending API error rates
item.description: Between 11:38 AM and 12:45 PM PST we experienced elevated error rates for our email-sending API to the SMTP endpoint in the US-EAST-1 Region. This did not affect the SendEmail/SendRawEmail HTTP APIs. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Informational message: Elevated email-sending API error rates
item.description: We've identified root cause and are seeing recovery for elevated error rates to our email-sending API in the US-EAST-1 Region for the SMTP endpoint. HTTP endpoints continue to operate normally.

item.title: Informational message: Elevated email-sending API error rates
item.description: We are currently investigating elevated error rates for our email-sending API in the US-EAST-1 Region for the SMTP endpoint only.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Delayed metrics in SA-EAST-1
item.description: Between 9:30 PM PST and 2:10 AM PST in the SA-EAST-1 Region, customers experienced increased delays in some metrics. During that time, alarms on delayed metrics may have transitioned into an INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. We have resolved the issue. Delayed metrics are in the process of backfilling in CloudWatch console graphs and for API retrieval. The CloudWatch service is operating normally.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Delayed metrics in SA-EAST-1
item.description: We are still seeing recovery in the CloudWatch metric delays in the SA-EAST-1 region. We are continuing to work to fully resolve the issue.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Delayed metrics in SA-EAST-1
item.description: We are still investigating delays with CloudWatch metrics in the SA-EAST-1 Region and are actively working to resolve the issue.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Delayed metrics in SA-EAST-1
item.description: We can confirm delays in some CloudWatch metrics in the SA-EAST-1 Region. We are actively working to resolve the issue.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Delayed metrics in SA-EAST-1
item.description: We are investigating increased delays for CloudWatch metrics in the SA-EAST-1 Region. CloudWatch alarms may transition into "INSUFFICIENT_DATA" state if set on delayed metrics.

item.title: Informational message: [RESOLVED] Internet connectivity
item.description: Between 1:08 AM and 1:53 AM PST we experienced intermittent packet loss to some Internet destinations from the US-EAST-1 Region. Network connectivity within the Region was not impacted. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Instance status check errors
item.description: Between 11:25 AM and 12:40 PM PST we experienced errors in the results from instance status checks in a single Availability Zone in the US-WEST-2 Region. We also observed CloudWatch alarms reporting "Insufficient Data" for affected instances. This issue impacted the reporting of instance status, however instances were healthy and operating normally. New instance launches were also operating normally. The issue is resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Informational message: Instance status check errors
item.description: We are investigating errors in the results from instance status checks and instance CloudWatch alarms reporting "Insufficient Data" in a single Availability Zone in the US-WEST-2 Region.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased API Error Rates
item.description: Between 5:01 PM and 6:51 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates for API requests and new EC2 instance launches in the US-WEST-1 Region. Running instances are not affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Informational message: Increased API Error Rates
item.description: We continue to investigate increased error rates for API requests and new EC2 instance launches in the US-WEST-1 Region. Running instances are not affected.

item.title: Informational message: Increased API Error Rates
item.description: We are investigating error rates for API requests and new launches in the US-WEST-1 Region.
